item.title: Junior Design and Layout Expert (Cat. II)

item.description:
External Support - Background Analysis and Brochure on Transparency and Traceability in the Garment Value Chain

General objective:

The present external support is aimed at assisting the Commission in compiling relevant information on transparency and traceability in the garment sector.

The output will be a background analysis and brochure to explain how traceability can turn the challenge of transparency into new opportunities: A growing reliable garment industry in which social and environmental standards are respected.

The target group of the brochure (leaflet/brochure/fact sheet) is in the first place interested citizens/consumers of clothing, however the various representatives of civil society and private sector active in the garment sector are also target audience (i.e. including companies, organizations, associations, academic institutions etc) in particular as a leverage to a wider audience, coming from all EU Member States and beyond.

Specific objectives:

The *specific *objectives of the assignment are to:

  • support the Commission in carrying out a background analysis to feed into work carried out on responsible management of the value chain in the garment sector,
  • provide a tangible output in the form of a brochure to be published to inform relevant stakeholders and the general public, in particular to help consumers of clothing to make informed purchasing decisions.

Junior Design and Layout expert (Cat. II)

  • Minimum 3 years' experience in designing layout of brochures aimed at the target audience as described in these terms of reference;

item.title: Cat.II Expert in Wildlife Management and Monitoring, Bio-Informatics and Information systems
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Support to Large Carnivore Sustainable Trophy Hunting

The project is aimed at improving the sustainability of exports of leopard and lion hunting trophies to the EU, and more generally at improving the sustainable management of Zambia’s leopard and lion population. The project should in particular aim at providing support to the DNPW to ensure that the hunting and export quotas established by the Zambian authorities for leopards and lions are conservative and sustainable, and to ensure that these quotas are based on adaptive management schemes.

Cat.II Expert in Wildlife Management and Monitoring, Bio-Informatics and Information systems

  • At least Master’s Degree in the field of environment. In the absence of a Master’s degree, the expert must have an equivalent extra professional experience (two years) in the below mentioned sectors,
  • At least 6 years of experience in the sector(s) related to the Lot;
  • Proven experience in large databases management, data analysis and information delivery to end users.
  • Proficiency in written and spoken English

Key experts should collectively have expertise in:

  • Extensive work experience in the field of ecology, in particular wildlife management, research and monitoring.
  • Specific experience regarding the biology of leopards, lions, their prey and the relevant conservation and management issues facing them will be an asset.
  • Demonstrated extensive experience and recognized expertise on sustainable management and conservation of large carnivore and the monitoring of trophy hunted wildlife populations, in particular leopard and lions. Respective experience in Zambia will be an asset.
  • Specific experience regarding wildlife trade and implementation of the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Fauna and Flora (CITES).
  • Specific experience in bio-informatics and information systems regarding wildlife hunting and trade would be an asset.
  • Specific experience in the management of sustainable trophy hunting activities. Respective experience in Zambia will be an asset.
  • Knowledge of the specific institutional context and organization of leopard and lion management and conservation in Zambia, as well as working experience with the Zambian authorities in charge of wildlife would be important assets.
  • Project management
  • Knowledge and experience in development and implementation of hunting database systems

Two Gender Experts Cat III (2*15 or 30 working days).

The Category III experts can either be a single person or two different people each responsible for a country. Please note that the Evaluation Committee will evaluate the expert(s) Cat III CV(s) as well as the Expert Cat I CV(s) in its evaluation.

Qualifications and skills

  • University degree certified by a Diploma (or equivalent professional experience of at least 5 years if candidate(s) do not possess a university diploma)
  • Good communication skills, both oral and written; ** Computer literacy (minimum MS Word, Excel, MIS). General professional experience
  • Minimum 3 years’ experience in the context of gender and development (this can include consultancy on gender development programmes as well as more academic works such as gender related studies etc.);

  • Knowledge of the development and gender context of Thailand and Malaysia.

  • Knowledge of development and gender context in South East Asia would be an asset.

item.title: Two Agriculture/Rural Development Experts with Food Safety or Veterinary/Animal Health Experience
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Evaluation of the EU-funded Support to Agriculture and Rural Development under IPA I

Global objective

The primary objective of this project is to evaluate to which extent the EU assistance provided under the IPA programmes 2007-2013 (IPA I) in the areas of agriculture, rural development, food safety and animal health/veterinary has reached its objectives.

Specific objective(s)

The specific objective of this assignment is to evaluate the achievements under the IPA programmes 2007-2013 (IPA I) in the areas of agriculture, rural development, food safety and animal health/veterinary and inform on the factors behind success or failure of this assistance and their geographical (urban/rural) and gender distribution.

Two Agriculture/Rural Development Experts with Food Safety or Veterinary/Animal Health Experience

Qualification and skills

Master degree in agriculture/economic/veterinary/health/business administration/ biology/ geography/ statistics; or a bachelor degree in agriculture/ economic/ veterinary/ health/ business administration/ biology/ geography/ statistics and 5 years professional experience (in addition to the minimum number of years of general professional experience required below).

General professional experience

  • Minimum 6 years, preferably 10 years of experience in the field of agriculture and/or rural development and/or food safety and/or veterinary/animal health.

Specific professional experience

  • Experience as evaluation expert in minimum one project, preferably three projects aimed at evaluating EU programmes financed under EU pre-accession assistance in the field of agriculture and/or rural development and/or food safety and/or veterinary/animal health.

The minimum number of working days for the two experts altogether is 100 working days.

Both experts should be proficient in English language and have very good reporting and communication skills.
